body_html:
The answer is actually pretty simple. If you want to further train the network, just increase FLAGS.max_steps. For example, if it was 100000 and you want to train up to 200000 then you only have to modify the flag.

You already removed the directory deletion part, so when you pass the checkpoint_dir as input to the monitored training session, it will automatically try to restore the latest saved checkpoint. Just increase the max_steps flag and you're good to go.
body_text:
The answer is actually pretty simple. If you want to further train the network, just increase FLAGS.max_steps. For example, if it was 100000 and you want to train up to 200000 then you only have to modify the flag.
You already removed the directory deletion part, so when you pass the checkpoint_dir as input to the monitored training session, it will automatically try to restore the latest saved checkpoint. Just increase the max_steps flag and you're good to go.
body:
The answer is actually pretty simple. If you want to further train the network, just increase `FLAGS.max_steps`. For example, if it was `100000` and you want to train up to `200000` then you only have to modify the flag. 

You already removed the directory deletion part, so when you pass the `checkpoint_dir` as input to the monitored training session, it will automatically try to restore the latest saved checkpoint. Just increase the max_steps flag and you're good to go.
